Oct 12 2009 	Amazing location and nice people.	The location is really excelent, even if you hanvent been to New York before. Just 2 minute walk to Times Square and one minute walk to Fifth Avenue. The rooms are smal, especially the double, but have good TV, clean bathroom and great bed. The people at the hotel are very nice and honest. Great stay - if I return to NY I'll be back!

Oct 10 2009	Convenient and good value	My sister and I were just staying one night in New York while we went to the US Open. The hotel was convenient to the subway, which took us directly to Flushing Meadows. It seems to be pretty well located if going to Broadway or other sight seeing adventures. There was only one reception clerk at check in time and there was a line. It went slowly, primarily because one of the guests had a problem. The clerk seemed a little flustered, but remained professional. The room was clean and newly remodeled. It was very loud outside, starting at 5am. The shower head was heavenly. Very adequate continental breakfast provided. I would definitely stay again.

Oct 9 2009 	Great location highly reccommended!	We had great service the whole 2 days we were there. Front desk people were very nice. We were able to buy tour bus tickets at hotel from very helpful and patient lady at service desk. Included basic breakfast of bagels, cereal and doughnuts. We had two rooms and both were very clean and not as small as I had expected. There were some spots in the hotel that needed minor repair or touch-ups, but overall it was nice and was very clean. The location was great. Two short blocks from Times Square and 1 block from 5th Ave. I thought it was noisy at night (although my husband didn't notice), might be better to have a room that didn't overlook the street. We had a great experience and it was the best price we found in that area for that weekend. Would definitely reccommend!

Oct 8 2009 	Now that it's remodeled we'll go back there year after year!	We love this hotel! The lobby is modern and beautiful. Our room was the perfect size for the two of us; it was updated, clean, and quite comfortable. The staff was professional and helpful, although we had no problems they needed to attend to. We enjoyed the generous continental breakfast in the newly remodeled spacious breakfast area. The location, so close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, and subways, has always been important to us, and we couldn't ask for a more convenient spot. It's a great value for the money. We travel to NYC every fall, and will definitely go back to the Hotel at Times Square!

Oct 6 2009 	Great stay	This is the 4th time I've stayed at this hotel and it was definitely the best visit as the renovations are finally finished. We had a room on the 9th floor; the room was decorated very nicely and quite large - it could have accommodated 2 cots in addition to the 2 queen beds. Room was very quiet (until at the dot of 7:00 a.m. each morning the construction outside began); bed was comfortable; housekeeping did a great job. The breakfast room has been enlarged and is organized much better than in the past. The breakfast offered is basic: bagels, toast, yoghurt, fruit and oatmeal, but a nice extra included in the price. The foyer and lobby have been updated and there are lots of couches and flat screens around, in addition to 2 computers and free internet access. The young lady who organizes tickets, etc. is most helpful in the lobby. The elevators can be slow, particularly at peak times, but no big deal. You can't beat the location of this hotel and we received a very reasonable rate. I will definitely continue to book this hotel in the future.

Sep 29 2009 	Just about perfect!!!!	Spent 4 nights here and have to say we couldn't have been happier. The twin queen bed rooms are spacious and well maintained. House keeping service was excellent and friendly. The breakfast downstairs was vey good,nice fresh doughnuts and bagels,butter kept in a mini fridge[great touch].Somebody has thought out customer service.My only mild negative was the in room coffee very weak needed two packs to make one good cup and please let's have china cups and saucers instead of styrotex.This will be my future base anytime I'm in Manhattan.

Sep 29 2009 	Best Deal in NYC!	I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. The service was great 24/7. We arrived early and couldn't go to our room but they let us check in and took all our baggage for us and stored it until we came back. The front desk and concierge were always very friendly and always went out of their way to help any way they could.The lobby of the hotel was very updated and modern. It had two computers that could be used by the guests at any time and lots of seating area. There was a fitness room and a HUGE breakfast room downstairs - the continental breakfast was really well done and a nice inclusion to an already affordable hotel.Compared to other hotels in this class/price range, the rooms were huge - ours had two double beds, a desk w/ chair, a flat screen TV perched on a fair sized chest of drawers, an arm chair, a full sized closet, air conditioning and a four piece private bath. I read that some people complained that the bathroom door was frosted glass. I went with a girlfriend and we tested it - you couldn't see through the glass unless you were leaned up against it and trying!! It also had free local calling and an alarm with MP3/iPod compatibility, which was nice when getting ready to go out and hit the town! Everything was so new and SO CLEAN!! Our rooms were done everyday and we received full linen change and fresh towels. There were four pillows on each bed and extra blankets in the closet.The location was awesome. It's between 5th and 6th, but a little closer to 6th. It took us less than 5 minutes to walk to the middle of Times Square. Because we were one block from the busiest part, I didn't find it very loud at all (mind you, we were on the 10th floor). There is a little bar in the hotel that is super small, but has great service, atmosphere, and super cheap martinis! Definitely worth stopping there for a drink or two before heading elsewhere.I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I have been recommending it to anyone who will listen. You will not be disappointed.

Sep 28 2009 	Excellent value - great location	A friend and I stayed here for a 5 day vacation in early September. The hallways are tiny, but the rooms were spacious for NY standards, comfortable and, most importanly, clean. Good (FREE) continental breakfast and friendly staff. Great location...easy walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station and other major attractions and close to major subway lines. For two friends travelling on a limited budget, this was an excellent hotel...highly recommended.

Sep 28 2009 	Very nice CLEAN and NEW furniture. Best price x location.	Perfect location, great price, decent breakfast. Room was very clean, has coffee machine, brand new tv, good tv channels, good lamps.

Sep 27 2009 	Great location- will return	We have stayed in many NYC hotel in different locations and this by far was the best for walking out your door into the heart of the "tourist" section of the city. Room was clean as was breakfast area and lobby, only negative was that our room and bathroom windown opened into the middle of the building. I would have been better off if I never opened the windown to see what was out there at all. Also, very nice bar on site, but the staff were very unfriendly and offered no local entertainment or food suggestions. Breakfast was standard cold cereal and bagels, but nothing I wasn't expecting. Overall, because of the how clean and updated the hotel was I would stay again for the cost. Also- we stayed here because it was near a subway that went directly to yankee stadium.

Sep 24 2009 	A real gem	After a very exhaustive internet search and months of planning this hotel was reccommended by a co-worker 1 week before our trip to NY. Great location, rooms were very clean, friendly/helpful staff, very quiet and comfy beds (so quiet and comfy we slept in and missed breakfast every morning!). We were surprised at the spacious rooms from what I read about the tiny rooms in NY hotels. We arrived at 1:00 and expected to store our luggage but our room was ready for us and storage on our day of departure was great so we didn't have to wheel our luggage around the streets. A nice surprise just across the street, a beautiful park and tribute to 9/11 victims (very touching) a quiet oasis to get away from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Very happy to have stumbled upon this hotel at the last minute. Glad to not have stayed right in Times Square as originally planned. Definately would reccomend to anyone! Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable!

Sep 17 2009 	Old Reliable...	I liked this hotel when it was the Super 8. The rooms are clean and the staff are very helpful. Despite the fact that there was a problem with the heater on the coldest day of January, I was supplied a space heater that worked just fine and within minutes. You can't beat the price and the location. I would definitely recommend and continue to stay in the future. In fact, I will be staying at the Hotel at Times Square next month.

Sep 17 2009 	good location	stayed in this hotel which was in a great location just off Times Square.Free internet PC's in lobby.Room was quite small given the cost but sufficient.the only problem wass that the bed lonen appeared not to have been changed before I moved in. Sep 9 2009 	Great Place to stay!	OMG Let me tell you about my visit to NY where we stayed at the Times Hotelfrom the moment we checked in until we left-4 days and3 nights the staff were so friendly and helped us in any and all ways. Sep 9 2009 	Nice hotel good location and value mediocre breakfast slow elevator	Stayed here over Labor Day. Nice, well-maintained, fairly new hotel with a good location near Times Square. Main drawback was very slow elevators and a mediocre breakfast (which was free, so it's hard to complain too much). Rooms were small but well decorated and maintained-very clean. Friendly staff.

Sep 8 2009 	No problems as usual	We have stayed here many times over the years. We kept going back since it is a solid hotel in NYC - clean rooms, good service, great location, breakfast and fitness room.

Sep 7 2009 	A good hotel for a decent price good location	We were traveling with our 1 Y.O baby, initially we got a really small room, and between the suitcases, the baby stuff and everything else, we had to hop around and over things just to get to the bathroom or out...The next day we asked to switch room and we were immediately transferred to a substantially bigger room.The rooms are nice and clean, the service we got was quick and helpful.There are only 2 elevators and one of them worked only half the time, though this didn't usually seem to be a problem. They have two computers with free internet access in the lobby, not a lot of privacy but it's quick and free.The breakfast is very good, containing fruits (apples and Bananas) cereal, different kinds of buns, cheese jam etc, coffee, donuts, juice. The location is great, two minute walk(one block) from times square and very close to the subway.

Sep 5 2009 	Great except for one minor glitch	We stayed at the Hotel at Times Square for one night. We arrived very early in the morning, and "checked in" at about 9:00am. We were given our room assignment, put our bags in storage, but obviously not room keys. We returned to the hotel at about 9pm for the night. After retrieving our bags and getting our keys, we headed up to our room. We were on the 3rd floor in a section that was only serviced by an old-fashioned service style elevator, with an elevator operator and all. Our kids thought this was really fun. Our room was small but otherwise just fine. We were all in bed by around 10:30. At 10:45pm my husband heard someone trying to enter the room. He jumped out of bed. We had thrown the door lock/latch. He looked and it was a family. They apparently had been given this room too, complete with newly coded room keys. They were just as surprised as we were, I suppose. We called to the desk to let them know this family was on their way back. Obviously the next morning our room keys no longer worked. But other than the momentary panic/surprise of thinking someone is breaking into your room when you're in it, we had an excellent stay and it was a great value and location. The parking rates cannot be beat either.

Sep 3 2009 	Great location and very clean	The service from the time we checked in to the time we checked out was exceptional. The room was clean when we arrived and very spacious for a NYC hotel. Very up to date with a flat screen TV and nice bathroom. The bathroom was small for some people, but nice. We did not mind the size as we are used to small bathrooms. Odd though that the door was glass, which was weird staying with my daughter. The hotel offers free continental breakfast, bagels, cereal, juice, coffee. It was all we needed to start our day, and being free in NYC is really a great deal. The rate was chep too. Less than $500 for a 3 nite stay, during the US Open. Location was the best. A short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue shopping. Very close to Grand Central, and not too far from Penn Station where we came into the city. Subway is close by too. There is a small park across the street, which made it a nice feeling as well. Plenty of places to eat as well, for all tastes and budgets.The best thing about the Hotel @ Times Square was the location. Each nite we finished up in Times Square. And we felt very safe in the neighborhood.The thing we liked the least was our view. There is none. The window looks out into a fire escape in between buildings. All in all, that would not deterr me from going back. It was a great stay.

Sep 1 2009 	Clean Quiet Convenient and Reasonable	After an exhaustive search (almost bordering on obsessive!), I found the Apple Core site and finally decided on the Hotel at Times Square. I am in the third day of my trip staying here, and I have to say I have been extremely pleased with the hotel. I think it's a tiny bit of a stretch to call it a boutique hotel, but it definitely lives up to its current reputation as a very pleasant, clean and extremely convenient hotel. My room on the 11th floor has been so nice and quiet, the beds are luxuriously comfortable (so comfortable in fact that I've missed each of the free breakfasts so far because I've slept in so late!), the rooms are perfectly cleaned up every day, and the free wi-fi is a real bonus. I had a small problem with my bathtub drain not working, and they were up within 10 minutes to fix it. Very efficient.The one downside (noted by a previous reviewer as well) is that they give you plastic and styrofoam cups in the room. I also read that the breakfasts are served all on disposable plates with plastic utensils as well. From andenvironmental standpoint, I think it's extremely wasteful and I hope management seriously looks into providing real cups, dishes, and cutlery as soon as possible. In addition, if they truly are trying to promote themselves as a boutique hotel, all the more reason to cut out the tacky and wasteful disposables. The only drawback in my mind to this otherwise pretty great and reasonably priced hotel!

Aug 23 2009	Location and amenities make for great value in NYC	We reserved this hotel from the Internet, and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Everything looks new and clean. Our party stayed in two rooms. Our room was slightly larger than the other, but both had all of the amenities (TV, wireless internet, an alarm clock with an IPod dock, desk and chair, and nice en suite facilities). The ordinary continental breakfast was a timesaver, and the location allowed us to walk to the theatre district, to shopping, and to restaurants. They give discounts to AARP or AAA members. We could not have been more pleased, and will return in the future.

Aug 21 2009 	Nice Hotel near Times Square	My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the last 2 days of a trip to NYC. We had stayed at the Ramada Eastside hotel, which is also part of the Apple Core chain of hotels. We wanted to stay in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, so decided to give this hotel a try, since we'd had a good experience at the Ramada.Overall, the Apple Core hotels are all pretty much the same. The rooms have been renovated and offer the same amenities at each hotel. I wrote a detailed review for the Ramada Eastside, so you can read that if you want more information.There are a few specific things about this hotel that are different from the Ramada Eastside. The staff at the Ramada Eastside were more personable, whereas the ones at The Hotel are a little less interested in you as a guest. The breakfast room at this hotel is packed in the mornings...a lot more tourists stay here with their families...so you may have to wait to find a table or place to sit and eat. Also, it's louder at this hotel, because of the location. The free wifi was a lot slower, and the computers downstairs were always occupied. Overall, it's just a busier hotel, with the same amenities you'd find at another Apple Core hotel.

Aug 19 2009	Location location location!! - but service standards a bit low and terrible consierge service	All who travelled and stayed at the hotel = Me: 29/female; Partner: 30/male; father 64/maleMy boyfriend and I took my father on one of our many trips to NYC. We chose this particular hotel because my father has some health problems and cannot walk far distances. In NYC, this is problematic of course because it is a pedestrian city. I promise that this hotel was the very best hotel to stay at with my Dad on the trip because it was the closet hotel to everything (most tourist sights) that tourists have heard of and want to see. We were a mere couple of blocks from Father Duffy Square in Times Square, and we were right in the middle of the theatre district (mere blocks from all the shows we went to see).Upon arrival, yes we also had the fellow who could not speak a word of english, but he was friendly enough. We were also provided little "welcome" packages of the small things you might need or have forgotton (toothbrush, toothpaste, tylenol, etc). It was a nice touch. There is also complimentary continental breakfast served every morning. Fitness centre and high speed interent included as well as boutiques on the main floor. The rooms themselves are standard sized (we stayed in a 2 bedroom double bed room). they are not incredibly small, but not overly large. They are comfortable enough. Our only issue was our television did not work when we arrived and we required extra pillow, so we called down to the front desk for service. It took a very long time for them to rectify the problem and to get more pillows to be honest, so we were a bit put off by their service standards.Clean rooms and it was nice to see that they had extra soap, shampoo and conditioner (knowing we were a party of three).The consierge looked to be a summer student who did not really care too much about her job. I asked her where I could get tickets for Billy Elliot, and she told me "the box office". Duh. I know that, but they are sold out and usually consierge helps out with this sort of thing. She was very hopeless and definitely NOT helpful.The Hotel is right beside a Dress Barn too, so ladies, lots of dress shopping too! We were staying there when the Pride Parade was going on and it was simply a block up the street, so it was convienient.A negative comment (besides the horrible consierge) would be that one of their two elevators was out of service, so we had to wait a LONG time for an elevator. A few times we took the stairs (we were on the 6th floor).In general, we would stay again just based on the location itself. Awesome location! Again, the rates my boyfriend found a decent rate of $160 for the first 3 nights and then $180 for the last two nights. Not too bad for such a great location. We would stay again....but do not suggest relying on the consierge for anything.

Aug 11 2009	be aware	I was given one price on cheap hotels when i reserved it, for 159,, then upon check in, they tried charging me over 200,,,, i showed the NON english speaking man and woman my printout,, so they still didnt honor my rate, they charged me 3 dollars over what i was given online,, when i got home and checked my card, they over charged me by 65 dollars,, i called they said they would call back, 4 hours later, he tells me that they over charge in case i watched movies or made phone calls. I was like "you knew when i checked out that I did not do that." so he says they will credit in 4 to 5 days, i now have to wait and see. Which is frustrating, becuase makes me wonder now what will they do with my credit card info. very dishonest. i will never stay here again. Its not as close to times square as they say,,, its about 6 blocks, and its not worth staying here. we were never thanked for check in or check out, and never told about any hotel amenities. never were told about the buffet, or fitness room, they must think we are mind readers. the consegierge, sent us the wrong way to the location we needed.

Aug 10 2009 	Best thing is the LOCATION! Easy to get everywhere	We just spent 6 days with our children ages 15 and 13. We booked a non-smoking suite--which had two bedrooms. One had a King bed and the other a Queen. Yes, the bathroom door was a bit see-thru. HahaWe found this hotel to be a great choice. Located in Midtown, it is easy to get everywhere in NYC, yet the actual street it is on ("Little Brazil") is quite quiet. Our rooms were small, but clean. The beds and pillows were awesome. We didn't plan to spend much time in our rooms, so the size didn't bother us. And because the hotel is located in a charming, older building, it is built like a rock with thick walls. We heard NO noise at all even though our rooms were located near the elevators.The continental breakfasts are only moderate, but suitable: Cold cereals, toast, bagels, doughnuts, coffee, juices, fruit and yogurts. It is definitely a good value.

Aug 7 2009 	Very nice excellent value!	Hi! I just wanted to contribute to good overviews of the place. After reading tons of reviews on Tripadvisor I finally booked the Hotel at Times Sq. and stayed there for 10 days in the beginning of May 2009. The key thing to share is that it is a great location for visitors, clean rooms and friendly staff. I would not say the place is luxury, it is just nice and clean with nothing disturbing or annoying. I have a very pleasant impression of the place and would definitely recommend it to people who came to see the city and not stay in the hotel for long. However, I should admit that very often one of two elevators does not work, one of two PCs with free Internet access in the lobby does not work, the breakfast is the same everyday. But believe me it is not that crucial for the money you pay.

Aug 5 2009 	...a little bit of heaven....	It was sure nice to come home to The Hotel @Times Square every night, after our adventurous, shopping and sight seeing days in New York! Everything you have read in all the other reviews is pretty accurate, and we enjoyed everything about the hotel, even our bathroom door. As you may have already read, the bathroom door is pretty see through, with some clear and crystal striping in the middle. To remedy this, I took a hanger out of the closet, and took a bath towel and clipped it lengthwise and hung it on the hook on the door. Viola'....problem fixed! You will find other places to stay in New York, but nothing that compares to this little piece of heaven, with as great a location and price, as The Hotel@ Times Square!!!

Aug 4 2009 	EXCELLENT VALUE CLEAN CLOSE TO EVERYTHING QUIET AREA	This hotel was great. Worked for my family. Rooms are not huge, but clean and bright. The morning breakfast is a great way to start your day. Staff was excellent. After looking at prices at other hotels, I thought that this place had to be a dump for what they were charging. I am happy to say I was wrong. The place is great. Just 1-1/2 blocks from times square. 1/2 block from 5th ave shopping. Worked great for wife, 2 kids 7 and 13 year olds. I really liked that you could get away from the mobs of crowds on times square. Right across from hotel is a nice plaza to relax in, and the best pizza slices are next to the plaza on 45th st. called Little Italy Pizza. Get the Calamari pizza slice, you will not regret it. We stayed 3 nights and were very happy with the hotel and its central location to sites, shopping, theaters, restaurants and subway right around the corner. I have stayed in nicer, larger hotel rooms that are true five star, but for the price to value you get, it is a five star stay in my book. I will be back to this place to stay again, I just hope that they do not get to popular, and raise the prices of the rooms.

Aug 1 2009 	Very Nice Accommodations Great Location Excellent Value	We just returned from 4 nights in the Hotel at Times Square. What a wonderful find! The hotel is is on West 46th street between 5th and 6th Avenues. It is an easy walk to Grand Central, Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square and Subway/Metro stops. Your hotel stay includes a reasonable breakfast (hot and cold cereals, fruit, yogurt, rolls, milk, coffee, hot chocolate, juices. The breakfast area is pleasant, well maintained, and has a goodly amount of seating. Our room had a king size bed and was very spacious by NYC standards. The A/C worked fine. The hotel has been recently refurbished. Front desk staff were courteous and helpful. A daily newspaper was included as was free WiFi access in the rooms. There is computer and printer access in the lobby to print boarding passes or check your email if you didn't bring a laptop. The hotel also has a cozy bar/lounge that serves very reasonably priced wine, beer, and cocktails. No restaurant in the hotel, but many, many to choose from in the immediate vicinity. All in all we were very pleased with our choice and would stay there again in (as they say) "a New York Minute!"

Aug 1 2009 	Wonderful NYC theatre district find.	My wife and I travel from Baltimore to NYC a few times a year for theatre and are always on the lookout for good deals on hotels in the theatre district. We book through the Quikbook website or by phone through their toll-free number. We recently spent three nights at The Hotel at Times Square and will certainly return. It has been recently renovated. The decor is upbeat. The rooms are adequate size, good beds and very clean. Buffet breakfast is included. Free phone calls from the room and free computer access in the lobby. It seems the owners have made a special effort to provide the cost-conscious visitor with all they really need for a good experience. The only downside was the concierge service.

Jul 27 2009 	A clean pleasant facility at a reasonable price in a great location.	We've stayed in this hotel twice, certainly will go back again. Rooms are clean and well maintained, the continental breakfast (included in room price) is quite satisfactory and is offered in a newly remodeled, pleasant breakfast room. The staff is most welcoming and accommodating. The location, just a couple of blocks from Times Square and a very short walk (even with a suitcase!) from Grand Central Station, couldn't be better. We literally walked everywhere we went--museums, shopping, Circle Cruise, Central Park, theaters, and great restaurants. If you bring a car, discounted parking is available across the street. We're picky, and we highly recommend The Hotel at Times Square.

Jul 27 2009 	Best Kept Secret in NYC	Booked this property based on reviews read here. The price was great ! The staff was friendly, the lobby area was nice, the free computers were great (had to wait sometimes but not long) The free breakfast was sufficient and definately saved us some money. Were were a few blocks from TImes Square, Steps away from 5th avenue and Rockefeller Center. The Subway (BDF) was just around the corner. I lived in NY for 30 years and this was my first trip back in 15 years. I could find no better deal online for any other hotel. At 165.00 a night this was the best kept secret in NYC. Would highly recommend and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We were 2 groups of 3 persons from Denmark visiting the highlights of The former New Amsterdam, and loved the hotel and location. Jul 22 2009 	Nice hotel but only 1 elevator operates	All in all it was a very nice stay. Clean rooms. Maid service was kind enough to leave plenty of shampoo and conditioner. Management was always warm and welcoming. Conceriege didn't have any stamps available for purchase for post cards. But most problematic was only one elevator in operation. When I inquired management informed us know they were just wrapping it up. However the very next day they started on the other elevator.....Elevator is used for handymen, maids and guests for all 12 floors.

My stay was for 6 nights and I had a large room on the 10th floor. i didnt expect a view as I wasnt in NYC to look out my hotel window. The breakfast was an extra bonus and offered the perfect selection for an Aussie traveler, as we are fans of cereal and toast for breakfast. The only thing missing was Vegemite! Jul 20 2009 	Excellent value service and location	Stayed for 5 nights recently. It's excellent value with modern, renovated rooms, good solid service and wonderfully clean. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped and serviced very well. Location is great, round the corner from the subway, safe and walking distance to so much. The hotel management obviously knows something about customer service and this shows in the staff dealings with guests. They respond quickly and appropriately to any issues. The breakfast buffet is more than adequate with a nice variety of food, continental style. The only criticism I have is that there are only styrofoam and plastic plates and utensils available and nothing seems to be recycled. Apr 19 2009 	Fantastic value-for-money hotel for hectic family trip to New York	The Hotel at Times Square describes itself as a newly renovated boutique hotel. I would say it's a superb value for money budget hotel with some great extras included in the package.We spent a week in The Hotel and loved enough to take time to write this review! At 59 W 46th St, The Hotel is actually closer to Rockefeller Centre - a plus for us, since it was quieter and less busy. I've been to New York many times on business, and usually stay on Central Park South - but our family budget for this trip was very different.The Hotel fitted the bill exactly. Before making our reservation, I looked at all the hotels I knew in New York - the "hidden gems" recommended by friends who live there, serviced apartments, and B & Bs in Greenwich and Tribeca etc. When I cross-checked with TA ratings, I just couldn't find anything that was cheap enough for the four of us which didn't compromise on location or quality. The Hotel is in a perfect location from which to explore on foot, by bus or by subway; it's surprisingly quiet at night (I had requested a quiet room and the hotel kindly obliged); there are plenty of good family restaus close by (eg. John's Pizzeria 260 W 44th St, Lattanzi on W46 th St) when the kids are close to dropping and you simply need to eat something good in a convivial atmosphere; it offers free wi-fi; there's ample hot water at night and in the morning, and a good supply of towels; comfortable King-sized beds; and it's newly refurbished, clean and well-kept throughout. Our bedroom was spacious enough to have a small desk and a couple of chairs, however public areas are small. There's a contemporary-style foyer which can be a little crowded in the morning but as the hotel only has 140+ rooms, it doesn't bustle like the Hilton on Ave of the Americas. For Central Manhattan at $ 150-160 a night for four of us and a free upgrade to a junior suite - it couldn't have been better! I think The Hotel is a great find.We were delighted and I would definitely recommend it to all friends who are looking for a good base for a sightseeing/shopping trip to New York. In these austerity times, the location, comparatively spacious rooms, a basic gym and free wi-fi makes it a possible choice even for business trips. It might not have the presence or charm of The Library, W or the Essex House but as an honest quality budget hotel, it's hard to beat.The breakfast bar in the basement is utilitarian rather than appetising or full of choice - but there are good typical American diners only a block away. The Red Flame on 67 W 44th St is one where you'll find a full pancake and syrup stack, eggs and grits. The Hotel has a Tapas Bar on the 2nd Floor (we didn't visit) and no restaurant as such - but when New York is full of superb choice - why worry? If you have small or young children flagging with jet lag, you can even order in (and actually the Jewish deli across the way does great pastrami!) A small grouse - it would be nice if the hotel staff on reception were a little more welcoming and learned to smile! - but I can live without that.The hotel's own website lists its facilities as follows:Complimentary continental breakfast (7-10 a.m.)Free Wireless Internet access24 Hour Business center24 Hour Fitness center incl. the "PowervibePro Workout Bench" (didn't have time to try, but there are pictures on the hotel's on website)No charge for calls within the U.SUpstairs Tapas Bar located on the 2nd floorConcierge Service availableReduced rate parkingChildren under 13 stay free when sharing room with adult(s)Flat screen cable TV with Movies on Demand & Nintendo video gamesAlarm Clock Radio (MP3 compatible) and iHome: audio system for the iPodIn-room personal safeLaundry/Valet servicesIn-room irons and ironing boardAir conditioning or heatingSingle or double roomsComplimentary newspaper weekdays (USA Today)In-room coffee makers with coffee & teaInfant Cribs (available at front desk upon request)Private bathroom with Hair DryerOur top "Things to See" (Parents plus two boys aged 13 and 11)Central Park (& the Carousel!)Natural History MuseumThe Metropolitan MuseumThe Whitney The Frick (for the Vermeer & Holbein)The Intrepid Museum (fantastic aircraft carrier turned museum- well worth a visit)Nintendo World (Rockefeller Centre)Sony Lab (free tickets in the morning - go early)Ellis Island ferry - for EI museum and Statue of LibertyEmpire State Building - the City Pass cuts down a 2 hour wait outside before the 1 hour wait for the lifts!)View from the RockRock and Roll Museum on Spring Street after a pizza at LombardisGround Zero - not everything is a Spiderman gameCentury 21 for discounted trainers (huge discount department store - close to GZ)Chrysler BuildingSerendipity for the largest ice creams ever seenI'd also recommend a City Pass (you can buy on line) to dispense with queues - though if you're travelling on a budget, be aware that some museums do not charge for children and some ask only for a contribution - so you have to make sure that you will see enough sights to make the pass worthwhile. And just walk and walk and walk.....!!!

Apr 17 2009	quite a deal and good location	My father and I stayed April 13-15, 2009 and had a great stay. I was a bit nervous booking on the internet. The wireless internet was a bit slow, but free so no complaints. The lobby hotel internet seemed to have a lot of problems, but I had enough luck printing our boarding passes for our flight back. We thought there was a Tapas restaurant on the second floor, but it turns out it's just a little bar (we didn't try it). The breakfast was great. We felt clean, safe, and like we got a deal. I would definitely recommend it.

Apr 17 2009 	Average	It has comfort of being in main area of the manhatten city and close to times square.It's small but neat room, free internet wireless facility with morning breakfast & gym.Little congested.but still good option for one who want to stay in the heart of the city and travelling for business or leisure.Location is just perfect.Jet Previlage Membership No. [--]

Apr 11 2009 	Clean spartan quirky	Stayed April 8-10 in a "family suite" of two rooms with two beds and two TVs, no refrigerator. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Others have noted the etched glass on the bathroom door. We solved that by taping some newspaper over it. The renovations others complained of seem to be done, at least in lobby and lower floors. Although clean and with new furnishings and carpet in rooms and lobby, it's an old building with oddities such as hallway doors separating adjoining elevators, some uneven stairsteps, and an unexplainable floodlight that goes on and off erratically in the airshaft (which was our only view). The bar on the second floor is little more than two small connecting hotel rooms. There are two free computers in the lobby but seemed to be a lot of competition for them. The free breakfast until 10 a.m. was well-stocked and convenient. The location is terrific, and the value is great (we paid $177 each night). Be sure to check out on time, though. We got a call at 12:25 p.m. warning us that we'd be charged another $25 if we didn't come down and check out immediately. Via Italiana and Ipanema on the same block were very good, modestly priced restaurants.

Apr 10 2009 	Great hotel at a very reasonable price	The Hotel at Times Square was in a great location (2 blocks from the heart of Times Square) yet was not as noisy as some of the Times Square hotels can be. Apr 7 2009 	Great value 	Paying for a US hotel in NZ dollars is scary! We wanted a good hotel in a handy location - without paying through the nose - and spent ages looking for one before settling on The Hotel at Times Square.We could not have asked for a better location - it was handy to the subway which provided easy access to all the attractions we wanted to visit that were not within walking distance. While the room was small, it had been recently redecorated and was nicely appointed.The best thing about the hotel is that breakfast is included in the rate. I calculated this saved us something like NZ$250 over the course of a week. Apr 4 2009	Excellent stay for the money!	Visited March 23 - March 28th. The price was right! The room with two double beds was large, quiet, well maintained and clean. No view, but wasn't in the room long enough to miss a view. The computers were up and running the day I needed to print boarding passes. The free wireless connection for our laptop was wonderful to have in our rooms to help plan our excursions. We leisurely made it down to breakfast, a little later each morning, but always found plenty of fresh pastries and fruit, coffee, cereal and yogurt and a table. I was impressed with how clean the breakfast room was no matter how late we arrived. Never waited for elevators because the stairs were next to the elevators, open and well lighted (in other words safe and not hidden away) and easy to take as well as a good way to work off extra calories. I was happy that the hotel was not in the middle of Times Squares (even though Times Square is in the name of the hotel). I felt very safe and comfortable in our location for this mother /daughter trip. Only needed to take subway for our Central Park stroll, Ellis Island visit, Century 21 shopping trip, and Greenwich Village stroll. It was so convenient to walk everywhere else. It was hard to believe this is a budget hotel. If pressed for concerns: There was one large high school group who were a bit loud the few times we ran into them (where were the chaperons?). I hope this lovely budget hotel does not become a haven for touring high school groups! Can't say that the concierge services were what I considered true concierge services, but didn't really care because we had a laptop in our room and with free wireless connections had trip advisor, hopstop.com, restaurant reviews etc. Everything we needed and no waiting. Overall the hotel was far better than what I expected for a budget hotel in NYC. I am sure the economy and time of year of our visit had a lot to do with the rates, but I did a lot of comparison shopping in preparation for this trip. Based on location, free wireless, free breakfast, room size, double beds and cleanliness, I know we got a great bargain. It really made it appear that our very budget conscious mother/daughter trip wasn't so budget conscious. Much gratitude for all of the advice and suggestions I found on Trip Advisor.

Mar 11 2009 	Centrally located friendly staff good breakfast.	Beds were very comfortable, very clean room with good quality sundries, walking distance to Times Square, restaurants, and subway.

Feb 1 2009	Good hotel for the price	Stayed here for 5 nights in January 2009. Had a two double bedded room on 10th floor looking out sort of sideways onto a rather large hole in the ground building site next door.The room was clean and comfortable, although a bit on the small size, but I wasn't in New York to spend hours in my room.There was noise from the building site or maybe from the refurbishment at 11 pm one night. but mostly it was daytime and not too early in the morning.Breakfast is included in the rate and makes this hotel good value for money and includes - bread rolls, toast (make your own), bagels, iced donuts, jam, three types of cereal, butter, cream cheese, apples, bananas, orange juice, apple juice, tea, coffee and milk. Jan 29 2009 	So perfect	We changed to The hotel at times square, after a horrible night at The Pod-hotel. I spent the whole night surfing for a good price and a good hotel. I decided to try this, and got really good rates from their own website. The street was silent, but on a great location, just a few blocks away from Times Square.I needed to print a car rent voucher, they didn't have a printer at the hotel, but I got directed to the comfort inn, just half a block away. There I got to print my paperwork. It was a bit cold in the room at first, but after contacting the reception, a maintaince guy came up and made his tricks on the warmer. After that, the temperature was great. So we really loved it, clean, silent and classy. No screaming youngsters in the corridor, or other distractions.There were two things we were a little bit confused about. The houskeeper, seemed to be a bit too enthusiastic about cleaning our room, she came into the room two times without knocking, and on the other time we had the "do not disturb"-sign hanging on our door. Jan 18 2009 	Great Location shame about the smoking room.	This hotel is very conveniently located for Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Dec 29 2008 	Great place to stay in NYC	We stayed at the Hotel at Times Square for a week from November 15 to the 22. My husband was travelling on business, and I accompanied him. The location was great, just a couple of blocks from Times Square, and within walking distance of everything I wanted to do in Midtown. I even walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in about 35-40 minutes (I am a fast walker). The room was completely acceptable, and although small, it was well laid out. We unpacked, put our suitcases in the closet, and the room was not cluttered at all for the entire week. When I made the reservation, I told the clerk we would be staying a week and he said he would note that and try to give us a bigger room, but I don't know if that was actually the case. We arrived at the hotel before noon and were able to check in right away. I would say the room was recently renovated and given a facelift, and it looked very modern. It had wireless Internet access which we had no problems with, and was necessary as this was a business trip. The only problem we had was the window was a bit drafty, and I thought there were too many long black hairs on the towels. This is a bit of a pet peeve of mine as I have a hair aversion, but I thought thick, coarse, black hairs were visible enough to be removed. The bathroom floor was heated, but we are not sure if that was by design or chance, in any case it was a nice touch. I think we stayed in room 604 (?) and the pipes were really noisy at times. It seemed like when the heat was on it was a bit less noticiable, but if you are a light sleeper it will definately wake you. I told the front desk about it and they offered to move us to another room, and had someone look at it (so maybe they fixed it). We chose not to move for our own convenience, and it was absolutely no reflection on the hotel staff, but it did seem less noticable for the last few days of the stay. The continental breakfast was a very nice touch, and had more than I needed for breakfast, yogurt, toast, cereal, doughnuts, all the usuals. It was clean and tidy and had an attendant at all times. We paid about $160 plus taxes for the room per night, which I thought was well worth it, especially for NYC. This is my third trip to NYC, and I would definately return to this hotel. If you are not looking for luxury, but a clean, standard hotel to base your days activities, this is it. The staff were extremely pleasant and we had no issues with the hotel at all. The bed was really comfortable, which is a big plus in my books!!!! Plus it has an ipod docking station which I thought was a really nice touch. It had some amenties of a higher end hotel at a budget hotel price. I am Canadian and usually stay at Delta hotels, I would put this more in the Comfort Inn line, but certainly at the higher end of this. We ate at a great Brazillian restaurant nearby, plus Burger Joint in the Parker Meridian, Keen's and Joe's Shanghai, all great spots. Definately stay at the Hotel at Times Square. Great hotel, great location.

Dec 25 2008 	Perfect location	Location, Location, Location. Only a block and a half from Times Square action. If you want to be near Times Square, this is your place. Don't judge this book by it's cover. This is a New York City version of a good Hampton Inn or HI Express. The facade is covered with scaffolding and it has a temporary sign. It's clean, modernized, and no doorman to tip! We stayed at this hotel the weekend before Christmas. We knew NYC tourism was down due to the economy and were thinking this was the year to go if there ever was one. We made the reservation just a week before departure and with taxes it cost about $179 USD per night. We arrived Friday morning and were surprised that our room was immediately available. (unheard of during the NYC holidays). Our room (821) had two double beds and two spacious closets. By NYC standards the rooms were adequate size. The TV reception was not great on our flat screen but I fiddled with the cable and it worked acceptably well. The bathroom lacks an exhaust fan (normal for an old building). The bathroom had a "sour rag" odor. Complimentary in room safe.Some other reviews have complained about the slow elevators but our waits were fine. As other reviews stated, the weakest area of service is the continental breakfast. It is more crowded than Times Square on New Years Eve. Supposedly, they are renovating the breakfast area so the breakfast is served in the small lobby. We had to keep reminding ourselves that it was "free". By eating there it probably saved our family of four $25-30 per day at NYC prices. There is a McDonalds around the block and several small Brazilian and Italian restaurants nearby.

Everything is quite classy, especially for a lower priced hotel. The flat screen TV was hot, and an iHome ipod dock/radio sat on the dresser. Pretty nice for $150 a night!The room was spotless and in perfect order. Everything was clean, looked like we were the first people to stay in the room, something I can not say for some other hotels I've stayed in for similar prices.Nothing about the hotel could have been better. The room was smaller than I'd expected, but only by a little, and was no problem at all. I'd recommend the Hotel at Times Square to a couple on a weekend trip, to a family of four, and anyone in between. Definitely a good find.

Dec 18 2008 	Location Location Location	Four of us stayed here Dec. 4th - Dec. 8th. We checked in early and was able to get our room. Had a late flight on Monday and put our luggage in storage. Dec 15 2008 	Quaint with good location	We just returned from a night's stay at "The Hotel at Times Square". This is the epitome of a quaint, European-stype boutique hotel. We came to New York to take in a show and the "holiday energy" of the city, so did not stay for long in the room. However, the location truly helped us enjoy every part of the city that we wanted to encounter -- from Broadway to Rockefeller Plaza and even a Paul McCartney sighting. Dec 14 2008 	GREAT DEAL - GREAT LOCATION - GREAT STAFF	I moved to The Hotel At Times Square after two nights at the Hilton Times Square... and I was not disappointed at all !Sure, at the Hitlon i could see the Empire State Building from my window at the 42nd floor... but believe me, if you are planning to spend your time in NYC just looking out of the window, I do guess there is something wrong with you! LOLBeing serious now. The location is great: just across the street from Times Square: you can truly reach it in less than 5 minutes walking.5th Avenue is at the end of the street; on the other side, you have 6th Avenue.This means that you reach the most popular attractions in a few minutes: shopping of 5th Avenue (Saks, Cartier, Tiffany and everything else), Rockfeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, BB King Club, Mme Tussaud and so on.The street is safe, and let me tell you that I stayed there alone - I am a young woman, and used to go out in the night too. I have never had a problem.From there, you can easily get a cab any time (day and night), or you can reach the subway in just a few steps (less than 5 minutes). if you like the bus, you can also jump on it: it is just at the end of the street (5th Avenue).The buildings around are not that gorgeus, but it is not a big deal, because the most beautiful architecture masterpieces of NYC are at a close distance.In the street, you can also find a "Monster Sushi": if you like miso soup and sushi-sashimi-maki, you will find it really exciting, and not expensive at all.And now the hotel: it is quite small, familiar and simple, with a small lounge with wooden walls and leather couches. The stairs are amazing, they look so old fashioned but at the same time they have clearly been renewed lately.The rooms are exactly the way the look in the pictures in the applecore site: the main colour is green, and the furniture is new.The bath has a reasonsable size, just don't forget to bring (or buy) your own shower cap, because they don't give that.Most important thing: rooms are perfectly clean, and they have 2 locks.The hotel is ver peaceful, anyway: perfectly safe even for a single girl.The staff is absolutely great: they are always so nice and willing to help, available at any time, no matter how obnoxious you can be!!The only problem is the noise, because windows are not soundproof: I had to use earplugs in order to be able to sleep. I don't think that the position of the room can make a real difference.What else can i say? I loved the hotel, the staff and the location: definitely i did not regret Hilton, where the price of one single night was higher than 3 nights at the Applecore.Great deal, great stay.

Nov 13 2008 	Great Room Excellent Location	Just returned from a terrific 4-night stay (Thu-Sun) at The Hotel at Times Square in New York City. (The street corner sign actually says "Little Brazil.") The street is one-way, so vehicles will need to approach from the 6th Street direction. There is some construction in the area, but it wasn't really a problem. This location is perfect for access to 5th Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway/Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park/New York Public Library, Museum of Modern Art, and Central Park. In addition, subway access is only a block or two away if you have to travel a little further than walking distance.Due to the close proximity to tourist locations, there always seemed to be pedestrian traffic nearby, so safety was never an issue when walking in the neighborhood, even late at night. Sep 24 2008 	Not bad :)	We have just returned from NYC and had the best time there. We chose The Hotel at Times Square because at the time that we were planning to be in New York, hotel prices were INSANE. The Hotel at Times Square was the cheapest one we could find in such a good location at $349/night. The reviews absolutely scared me. This hotel used to be a Super 8. And most websites gave it 2 stars or less. But, when arriving to the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. I am very new to writing these reviews, so let me just go with a pro and con list...PRO:- The hotel is within a few blocks (definitely walking distance) to times square.- The rooms were clean (majorly important!)- The bed was soft- MOST of the staff were friendly- Free internet- Free continental breakfast.- 24 hour Business Center (small but adequate)- Concierge helped point out nearby food delivery places, was able to buy our theatre tickets and pick them up for us, and was able to coordinate shuttle transportation for us. CONS:- The hotel is old, so expect small and slow elevators.- The bathroom was on the small side. Some rooms seem to have a little bigger bathrooms than others.- As I mentioned earlier, the hotel is old, though the rooms are renovated, the tightness and awkwardness of the hallways and stairways show you the age of this hotel.-The internet's wireless capabilities didn't work in our room, front desk didn't have any more ethernet cables, so we were without internet the first day - The business center, breakfast room, and fitness facility are in the bottom floor of this hotel and as far as I'm concerned I was a little scared to go down there! - There's no real restaurant within the hotel itself. However, there's loads of restaurants who deliver, and concierge can give you some menus and phone numbers. - Cabs do not know this hotel so just tell them the address...and not 59 W 46th street, you have to say "46 street between 5th and 6th Ave" and usually they'll get it right.So, the end result...this hotel is not a four star hotel...it's old, it's small. BUT, it gets the job done. Its clean, it's near times square and radio city and build-a-bear, and all those things. Would I stay here again? If the price was right..sure. If you're a business person who needs a lot of upscale technological amenities, or if you're a person looking to be pampered on your next trip...Don't stay here.But if you someone who just needs a clean, moderately priced place to rest his head after a day in New York, then this is a good place for you.

The package materials were given to us on Day 4 and weren't available even then, in the morning before we checked our bags and checked out of our room. We were given a bag at 4 p.m. when we came back for our luggage. The bag contained gingerale instead of water, coupons for a mall outside of New York City and no restaurant coupons. I left them on a table for anyone else to use. I fought for 3 days for a discount based on all of the things that had gone wrong during our stay.Positives: Comfy bed in a fairly large for New York room, which was quiet. Coffee pot in room. Nice business center with 3 computers. When the repair people came for the TV and phone, they were professional. Good location for theatres and subway. Negatives: It took 4 hours, 2 calls and a trip to the front desk to get extra pillows. Phone was broken for 2 days which negated the supposed perk of free calls. TV reception very poor -couldn't get Channels 2-7. 3rd evening had only lukewarm water, 4th morning , only cold. Former visitor's make-up brush was found on day 4, on side of bed, when we were checking that we hadn't left anything ourselves. Breakfast was a mob scene each morning with no tables. Clerks had great difficulty with keeping up with the turnover and replenishing food. Only green bananas were available. Concierge misdirected us to the Metropolitan Museum, which you would think would be a popular spot in NYC!For the entire weekend, there were tools and tape left at the top of the stairs for anyone to trip over. Also, paper was left on the elevator floor for 2 days.On a sheet listing the hotel services given to guests at check-in, guests were asked to leave positive reviews on-line. I'm sorry that I honestly can't.

Aug 14 2008 	Great Location!!	This hotel was recommended to us by our neighbor. I would definitely recommend it. I had to laugh at the last review as we had the same problem finding the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised when we got there. Everyone was friendly, check in went smooth. As far as the room size it was definitely adequate. We stayed in Paris a couple of years ago and this room was twice the size. The rooms were very clean and always made up properly. The room where the continental breakfast was served was adequate and it was a mob scene but the price was right (included in cost of hotel). If you are looking for fine dining and a quiet place to have breakfast you have to pay the big bucks elsewhere. I also had to laugh at the 7am "wake up call" with the jackhammers next door. I guess that is the price to pay in an ever changing city. We also liked the fact that you could call on the telephone anywhere in the USA for no charge. In my family's opinion, don't let the bad reviews scare you. Go and find out for yourself. After all it is a place for you to hang your hat at night. Enjoy the city. We sure did and will be back again.

Aug 8 2008 	Great NYC location	First of all, our cab driver could not find the hotel so we just got out at the curb in the block it was supposed to be in. Currently there is a canvas sign over the marquee, naming it The Hotel at Times Square.We picked this hotel due to great location--46th between 5th and 6th--and a couple positive reviews on this site after remodeling in the spring.The staff is friendly (not always the case in NYC?) and the decor is nice after the remodeling. For NYC, we thought the value was great--$209/night with our AAA discount.Two caveats--construction next door starts about 7 a.m.--may be hard to sleep in. Second--the continental breakfast is a consistent mob scene. The earlier you get down there, the better. Lots of foreign tourists due to the weak dollar.Re: the TKTS booth for same day show tickets--it is only about three blocks away but it would have been nice if the concierge had mentioned they take cash only. the lines can be long, but they move quickly. We got good seats for the play we wanted (The 39 Steps was great) at half-price.If we returned, we would defintiely consider staying there again.

Aug 4 2008 	Good value but beware of false advertising	This is a tough review to write. The room we stayed in was a nice room for the price, considering you are in the Times Square area. We had two double beds and a bathroom. The problem is that we booked our room through Super 8's website. And their website clearly stated that we would have a room with two double beds AND a sleeper sofa--which is important for a family of 6. When we checked in and went up to our room on the 10th floor, imagine our surprise to see only two beds and no sofa. When I went back to the front desk, I was rudely told that I was wrong about my reservation. They put me on the phone with the manager who explained that they have NEVER had rooms with two beds and a sleeper sofa. We made due with the situation and two of our boys slept on the floor with extra blankets making up their "beds".Given the false advertising on Super 8's website, and rudeness of the front desk, we won't be staying here again. Jul 30 2008 	Basic accommodation	This hotel has basic accomodation and if you get a good price it may be value for money in a very central location. However for the price I paid I expected more. The pictures on the website are deceptive it shows a light bright large room, whereas the room i had was dark and grim and small (needed the lights on in the day time to see), this wasn't helped by very dirty windows.The room had been recently refurbished so the wallpaper etc was new however the bathroom was tiny and shabby.The experience at the hotel (end July) was not helped by the noise, the noise from the street added to by the construction going on at the side of the hotel. Given that this is currently a large hole I would anticipate that the construction site (with the sound of lorries and diggers as early as 5am) will be there for some time to come. It appeared to me that the windows are not double glazed so even on a high floor you hear all the noise. The lifts in the hotel are extremely slow and busy and not helped by congestion caused by the cleaners trolleys, but also on the day I was checking out one of the lifts was out of order so I had to wait for a lift for over 20 minutes as I could not have carried my suit case downstairs.Do not be seduced by the 'free' breakfast, this is a basic low quality buffet in the basement and is a bit of a fight for space - I gave up after the first morning and preferred to pay for decent food in pleasant surroundings.The reception staff on check in could not have been more helpful, however the lady who checked me out was extremely unpleasant she made various mistakes and seemed to be getting angry with me because of her mistakes - perhaps she was just having a bad day but I at least expected an apology at the end of the tortous exercise of checking out but non was forthcoming.To sum up I would give this hotel a miss while the contstruction is going on, I would then only consider if you need a central location but are on a tight budget and get a very cheap deal and expect to be out of the hotel room for most of the time.

Pleasantly surprised. Excellent value.	We were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Found out about it on Tripadvisor and wasn't dissappointed. Found the best rate on the hotel's website as the travel sites did not account for the AAA discount. Room was bigger than expected ( for NY standards) and appeared to have been renovated recently. Staff was friendly and helpful. It was not a luxury hotel by any means but extremely nice for the price. Subway was 1 block away and Central Park was about 3 blocks. Would definitely stay there again.

Skip if looking for luxury	Just stayed at The Lucerne over Thanksgiving. I'll make it simple: if you are used to luxury hotels and are hoping to have found an inexpensive gem on the UWS you will be sadly disappointed. If you are used to mid or low range chains, you might be pleasantly surprised. This is not a luxury hotel by any definition. And like the other choice in the neighborhood - On the Ave - it is also the permanent home to at least several long-term residents grandfathered in by NY rent control laws, so don't be surprised to smell cooking or see a small family living in a one room. In my opinion, this slice of New York life does not add character, rather it gives the hotel an air of being a flop house, highlighted by the drab, institutional hallways, cheap blankets, grimy shower curtains, unhelpful and cheerless staff, and a general sense of disease... In sum: I can not recommend for anyone who is accustomed to 4 or 5 star hotels. It is 3 stars at best, and less if you take into account the permanent resident situation.

Subway downtown just a 2 minute walk. Nov 1 2009 	Nice hotel fantastic Upper West Side location	My husband and I stayed here for six nights in September. We were travelling with our 14-months old son and wanted to stay in a child-friendly area close to the park. I love Upper West Side but had never stayed here before. When we started to look for hotels in NY, we thought that The Lucerne was pretty expensive, but what hotel in this city isn't? We decided to book the Lucerne (with the AAA rate), and were happy that we did. We requested a room on a high floor and was put on the 10th floor. We stayed in a corner Deluxe Double Room, which was very spacious and perfect for our little boy to crawl around. We asked for a crib for our boy. The first one was really squeaky and woke him up every time he moved, but thankfully housekeeping replaced it with a quieter one.The room was very nice and well kept, so was the bathroom. The front desk staff was nice, not overly friendly but correct, the bellboys were super nice and helped us with our stroller every time we came and left.We had all of our meals out, but needed boiled water to make oatmeal for our baby, for which the coffee maker worked fine. The location is perfect if you're looking for a quieter area in New York (well, New York is never really quiet) or if you're travelling with children. It's two blocks from Central Park and Museum of Natural History. Our favorite breakfast place, Sarabeth's, is two blocks up on Amsterdam Av, couldn't have been better for us! A lot of strollers in the neighborhood and baby chairs in every restaurant that we went to. If we can't find a better deal next time, we'll definitely stay here again!

Oct 28 2009 	My new favorite spot in the city: a lovely SILENT hotel room in NY!!	I just spent one night at the Lucerne, based solely on the fab reviews here. I've stayed at many hotels in town (Essex House, The London, Elysee, Dylan, Morgan's, The Hudson, etc.) and NONE of them could offer what the Lucerne provided: an absolutely SILENT room! When I say my room was silent, I do not mean that the traffic noise was really well-muffled. I mean that my room was absolutely silent all night long - like sleeping in a vault. There was no noise, no sounds. None. I slept from midnight until 7 AM, and the only sound I heard was my own breathing - and I'm not a loud breather. And here's the kicker - I was on the 4th floor! Go figure. When I checked in, I asked the delightful gentleman at the desk for the quietest room in the hotel. That is always my only request because I have super-sensitive ears & can hear everything. I almost always end up resorting to earplugs whenever I'm in NY because it's the only way I can sleep. Never again. From now on, I'm only staying at the Lucerne. If silence is a necessary luxury for you, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.I agree with everything everyone else has said about the spotlessness of the hotel, the charming decor, and the really spectacular staff. The bell staff opens the door for everyone, whether you're coming in or going out. That may sound like a lame thing to mention, but frankly, I find that it's a very nice touch. The front desk personnel are also exceptionally polite and pleasant. I love the location of the hotel for all of the reasons that have already been mentioned, by others. There is nothing negative that I can say about this hotel. It deserves all of the terrific reviews & I can't wait to stay there again.

Oct 19 2009 	Clean affordable and great location.	This was a very nice place. The rooms were bigger than most we've seen in NYC, and very clean. Oct 15 2009 	Home away from home in NYC	During this, our first visit to NYC, we chose the Lucerne based on our following wishes: a stay in a quiet but central neighborhood, close to the subway and reasonably (for New York!) priced. The Lucerne was excellent on all accounts - the staff was very courteous and extremely helpful. Our queen room, although not huge, was still adequate according to this city's standards, and the coffee machine (it wasn't in the room but we asked for it, after reading about this free amenity on the hotel's website) was provided instantly and was MUCH appreciated every morning, along with the excellent Wolfgang Puck filter coffee. I also liked getting a complimentary newspaper left at our door each morning (NY Times or USA Today). The room was nicely made up everyday to our satisfaction and having things like an iron and ironing board, along with an umbrella, was greatly appreciated by us, as we were staying for a week and enjoyed the home-like atmosphere. These were all very thoughtful and practical touches. We had breakfast in the downstairs restaurant, Nice Matin, only twice as it was a bit pricey, but it was very good. However, there are a ton of other places to grab a quick, tasty and cheaper breakfast in this wonderful area (Zabar's, H&H Bagels) on the Upper West Side. Also, having a subway station only a 5-minute walk from the hotel made our visit a whole lot more pleasurable. With taxes, the whole stay came out to about $295 a night which, although not cheap, is quite OK, price-wise, for a Manhattan stay. The hotel is 2 blocks away from Central Park and also the Natural History museum. We would definitely stay there again, no hesitation whatsoever.

Aug 25 2009 	So Good Went Back a 2nd Time	There are hundreds, maybe thousands of hotels in NYC and making a choice of hotels and neighborhoods is difficult, at best. Aug 3 2009 	Great location and value	We just got back from a two night weekend stay at the Lucerne with my wife and three year-old, a very positive experience.We drove into the city, and it's easy to get to by car from the west -- just headed over the George Washington Bridge, down the Henry Hudson, made a left onto 79th St and boom, you're there. There is a decent sized loading area in front, and the doorman was helpful. He asked if I wanted to use their parking service, and I said I thought I could probably find street parking (it was a Friday evening). He said I could park across the street using the meters until 7, and that he would let me have his space on 80th St. when he was off his shift at 9. Very nice of him! Turned out, I immediately found parking on the street a couple of blocks away so I didn't need it. Early on weekends, you can usually find free street parking on the Upper West Side.I checked in and received an upgrade to a Deluxe King Suite from a Deluxe Queen, which I didn't necessarily want but didn't mind. The suite consisted of a bedroom and large living room with desk, couch and chair. There were tv's in both the living room and bedroom. In between was a bathroom, fairly small, and a very small kitchen area with an empty fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bath had a tub, which is great if you have a little one. Some dishes and utensils were provided. It would have been nice to have some glasses in addition to the plastic cups provided though. All of the furnishings were very comfortable, and the bed was very nice. Overall, this came for a price that would get you a boring single room in many name-brand Manhattan hotels, if that.There were separate air conditioners in the two rooms, and if anything, they were a bit too powerful. The windows actually open. Free wireless internet is provided, although it was a little slow.The service was great. Every single person working there treated us well and very pleasantly.The room was on the 4th floor, and as others have pointed out there was some street noise. Both Amsterdam and 79th are busy streets, and there are some bars and restaurants on Amsterdam that generate some noise. It didn't bother us though. If you are bothered by noise, you should request a room on a higher floor, or facing the back.The location is fantastic, especially if you're traveling with a small child. In the immediate neighborhood you have Zabar's (a large upscale market) around the corner on Broadway, so you can pick up food there and self cater if you want, with the fridge and microwave available. You also have H&H bagels and a number of other places. The restaurant downstairs looked very nice, but we didn't eat there. The American Museum of Natural History is a very short walk away, as is Central Park. There is a very nice playground (Diana Ross) at the 81st Street entrance to Central Park. The Met and Guggenheim are also a pleasant, ~20-25 minute walk away through the park.The 1 subway line is right at 79th and Broadway, literally a 2-5 minute walk from the front door. That will take you right to Times Square and downtown. If I were going to NYC for a Times Square/theater/shopping centered vacation, this is a great location to stay, as all of those things are easily accessible, but you're in a much more real, less touristy location.Overall, a great experience, recommended especially if you have kids.

May 19 2009 	Great Hotel	We stayed three nights at the Lucerne. The value for the price is excellent. The rooms are clean and well maintained. May 19 2009 	Love Returning Time After Time - Never Disappointed	My wife and I have stayed at the Lucerne several times since discovering this hotel in 2000, and we continue to be charmed by this hidden gem. On our most recent trip, we stayed at the Lucerne immediately before leaving on, and then upon returning from, a two-week trip to Europe. What a great place to recover from jet lag!The staff at the Lucerne  many of whom have been there since we starting visiting  are warm and welcoming. They treat people as honored guests rather than simply customers.The hotel offers the amenities we expect today, including 24-hour room service (provided by adjacent and neighboring restaurants with which the hotel has arrangements), a modest fitness center, wireless Internet connections, hair dryer, ironing board and iron, and bathrobes. But the Lucerne also offers several things many other hotels dont: location, charm, and value.The Lucerne is located at 79th and Amsterdam on Manhattans Upper West Side. Its an active New York neighborhood with several Zagat-rated restaurants nearby (including the adjacent Nice Matin, and a Coppola's across 79th Street), as well as plenty of shopping and entertainment, all within easy walking distance. The hotel is one block from the 1-2-3 subway lines, which is quite convenient for exploring other parts of the area or getting to your meeting downtown. Its also within striking distance of Central Park, the American Museum of Natural History, and Museum Mile.Were told the building, completed in 1904, once housed a dormitory for a nearby university. Today, it offers over 180 rooms and suites.Clearly, the management of the hotel understands how important it is to stay current and contemporary. Within the last couple of years, the hotel has completed thorough renovations of its guest rooms and, as we've come to expect, everything is top-notch. Our most recent stay was in a small suite, which had two queen beds in the bedroom and a sofa, TV, microwave, fridge, and service items (plates, cups, flatware) in a second, smaller room. It was more than adequate, though the King suite I enjoyed during a recent business trip was the absolute top of the line! However, I would describe even the Lucerne's standard rooms as cozy, not cramped, as have been others at which Ive stayed in the City  including a room at a major chain off Times Square.Finally, the Lucerne offers excellent value. During the business trip I mentioned, staying at the Lucerne saved my company $150 over the chain hotel they'd booked for me in the Financial District. The bean counters were not unhappy (are they ever "happy"?)Whether traveling to New York City for business or pleasure, we highly recommend the Lucerne! We'll certainly be back.

May 18 2009 	Almost perfect experience	Four of us stayed at the Lucerne over Mother's Day weekend (early May '09). Two moms and our 2 sons. The beds were comfortable, though the pull out was not. Plus when you pulled out the couch, we had to move the desk so that we could squeeze by to the bathroom. But that's NYC for you! Very nice lobby and hallways. Champagne and chocolates on Mother's Day. Clean, smelled nice, and nicely decorated. Our only problem was that the first day, the AC in the sitting room froze over - the compressor coils literally had ice on them and the unit was not blowing cold air. Since we had a 2nd unit in our sleeping area, I didn't call the front desk. Unfortunately, the 2nd nite around 9 pm the 2nd unit also froze over, so we had no AC. I didn't call the front desk because I know from my husband's AC business that this was not a quick fix at a time that we wanted to go to bed. I regretted my decision when the room got hot and stuffy in the middle of the night and no windows to open. In the morning when I check out, I explained the situation to the manager (Darren) and asked for a deduction on our room, he asked why I had not called downstairs the night before. Also, he said since I had the least expensive rate already, all he could do was to give me an upgrade the next time I was at his hotel. Not sure I feel so great about that. On the other hand, we did have a great rate. And it's a nice hotel in a nice area. Go to Cafe Con Leche around the corner for the best coffee.

May 13 2009 	Lucerne was Great! We'll be back!	Stayed at the Lucerne May 6-12 - everything was great. Subway just 1/2 block away, Central Park 2 blocks, nice area. Room was clean and roomy! Nice Matin, the restaurant next door was great - breakfast was good and hottest coffee around! Will definately stay at the Lucerne next trip to NYC!

May 5 2009 	What a find!!	We have visited NYC many times over the years, and always have stayed at moderately-priced hotels. Most of the time, this requires certain tradeoffs. Not this time. From now on, we will stay here every visit.

Apr 26 2009 	Great NYC experience	This hotel is located on the Upper West Side near Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. Apr 24 2009 	Lovely	Great location, and well-maintained. Close to subway, restaurants, park. Room was very nice but New York tiny. Friendly front desk but not really much customer service. Apr 21 2009 	Perfect location for Central Park and the Museum of Natural History : )	My daughter and I were in New York for a fun, sightseeing, show-seeing long weekend in March. Apr 15 2009 	We've found our home away from home in NYC	We visit our son attending Columbia U. in NYC from time to time, and the Lucerne has become our hotel of choice. Apr 14 2009 	An excellent friendly hotel in a great part of New York	We took a long time before deciding to book the Lucerne and found the tripadvisor reviews were pretty much spot on. Apr 12 2009 	We would recommend to friends and family	The Lucerne is located on New York's Upper West Side. It is a nice boro of the city close to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. The Lucerne is located very close to subway terminals as well. The hotel room we stayed in ( 1queen bed) was small (typical of NYC) but very nice. The bathroom had upscale granite and bath tile. The closet is also small. But the room was clean and fresh. The doormen and concierge were very helpful to us during our stay. There are many small deli/markets nearby if you need anything. A larger market called Fairway Market is not too far away if you need anything more extensive then what the smaller markets have. For breakfast, if you want a quick cheap breakfast I recommend the danish /coffee cart down 79th close to the subway terminal or H&H Bagles at 79th and Broadway. I avoided the hotel restaurant for breakfast. Also, I reommend going to Smoke at West105thStreet. Outstanding jazz........very intimate.

Apr 12 2009 	I'll Stay Here Again	Although I hadn't spent much time in NYC prior to this trip, I know that we found a keeper. Apr 5 2009 	Wonderful choice for NYC - Great Value	This hotel has been beautifully redecorated with very nice rooms and baths. Staff is excellent.
